page.title: 16Acklington Characters (1)
page.content: {Bob Shanks,}our eldest inhabitant at 89, lives at Coal Houses. He remembers fighting in World War I when, after having been no further than Newcastle, he was suddenly sent to Hong Kong with the Royal Garrison Artillery. {Ethel Thompson}has lived in the area all her life. She is 74 years old, a widow, and lives alone at Cherry Tree Cottage. When it is fine she spends a lot of time gardening and during the dark evenings she enjoys needlecraft, and watching T.V. Ethel would like to see an improved bus service for the village and less low-flying aircraft. {Jim Dibble}is a retired London head- teacher who came, with his wife Ruth, to Inglenook to live. He enjoys walking on the hills of his native Northumberland and is learning to play the Northumbrian pipes. Jim wishes the weather up here was a bit warmer.
